intro: Capsella gallica, commonly known as mouse-ear or mouse-ear cress, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is an annual or biennial herb that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, yellow flowers with four petals and heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in disturbed soils and can often be found along roadsides and in gardens. The seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution.
